intro: Phagnalon intermedium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. The plant has slender, ascending stems and linear to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers are arranged in composite heads, which are characteristic of the daisy family. Phagnalon intermedium is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it a common sight in Mediterranean and temperate regions.
